manufacturers.name: NCS HealthCare of KY, LLC dba Vangard Labs
Advanced Rx Pharmacy of Tennessee, LLC
Amneal Pharmaceuticals of New York LLC
Heritage Pharma Labs Inc. d/b/a Avet Pharmaceuticals Inc.
Heritage Pharmaceuticals Inc. d/b/a Avet Pharmaceuticals Inc.
Hetero Drugs (a common manufacturer for 'Noflu' brand)

drugClasses.name: Herpes Simplex Virus Nucleoside Analog DNA Polymerase Inhibitor [EPC]

drugs.description: Used to lower cholesterol and reduce the risk of heart attack, stroke, and chest pain in adults with heart disease risk factors.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Blocks an enzyme in the liver that produces cholesterol, helping to lower total cholesterol and LDL (bad) cholesterol levels.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include cold-like symptoms, joint pain, diarrhea, and urinary tract infections. Serious muscle or liver problems may occur.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated to lower cholesterol and reduce the risk of cardiovascular events like heart attack and stroke.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take orally once daily, at any time of day, with or without food. Usual starting dose is 10 to 20 mg.

drugs.description: A thyroid hormone replacement used to treat hypothyroidism (underactive thyroid) and certain types of goiters.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Replaces natural thyroid hormones not being produced enough by the body.
drugs.sideEffects: Adverse reactions are rare if the dosage is correct. Overdose may cause symptoms of hyperthyroidism.
drugs.boxedWarning: Do not use for weight loss. Large doses can cause serious or life-threatening toxicity.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for hypothyroidism and as a pituitary TSH suppressant for treating goiters.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosage is individualized based on patient response. Take orally, usually starting at a low dose and adjusting based on lab results.

drugs.description: A combination medication used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) to lower the risk of stroke and heart attack.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Combines an ACE inhibitor (lisinopril) that relaxes blood vessels with a diuretic (hydrochlorothiazide) that removes excess fluid.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, headache, cough, and fatigue. Can cause low blood pressure.
drugs.boxedWarning: Stop taking immediately if pregnant. Can cause injury or death to the developing fetus.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of hypertension (high blood pressure).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosage is guided by clinical effect. Typically substituted for patients already stabilized on the individual components.

drugs.description: Used along with diet and exercise to improve blood sugar control in adults with type 2 diabetes.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Combines two drugs: one increases insulin release (sitagliptin) and the other decreases sugar production and absorption (metformin).
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include diarrhea, upper respiratory infections, and headache.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risk of Lactic Acidosis, a serious metabolic complication that can result in death.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated as an adjunct to diet and exercise to improve glycemic control in type 2 diabetes.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take twice daily with meals. Dosage is individualized based on current regimen and effectiveness.

drugs.description: Used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and chest pain (angina).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Relaxes blood vessels, making it easier for the heart to pump and reducing blood pressure.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include swelling (edema), dizziness, fatigue, and nausea.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for hypertension and coronary artery disease (chronic stable angina and vasospastic angina).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take orally once daily. Adult starting dose is usually 5 mg, with a maximum of 10 mg.

drugs.description: Used to treat high blood pressure, angina (chest pain), and to improve survival after a heart attack.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: A beta-blocker that slows the heart rate and relaxes blood vessels.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include tiredness, dizziness, depression, shortness of breath, and slow heart rate.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for hypertension, angina pectoris, and myocardial infarction (heart attack).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take once daily with food. Dosage is individualized; for hypertension, usually starts at 100 mg daily.

drugs.description: Treats frequent heartburn that occurs 2 or more days a week.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Reduces the amount of acid produced in the stomach.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for frequent heartburn. Not for immediate relief.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take one tablet daily with water before eating in the morning for 14 days.

drugs.description: A combination medicine used to lower levels of total cholesterol and LDL (bad) cholesterol.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Combines two actions: blocking cholesterol absorption in the intestine and inhibiting cholesterol production in the liver.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, increased liver enzymes, muscle pain, and cold symptoms.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated to reduce elevated LDL cholesterol in adults with hyperlipidemia or homozygous familial hypercholesterolemia.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take once daily in the evening, with or without food. Dosage range varies from 10/10 mg to 10/40 mg.

drugs.description: Treats high blood pressure and protects kidneys in patients with type 2 diabetes.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Blocks a substance in the body that causes blood vessels to tighten.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, cold symptoms, stuffy nose, and back pain.
drugs.boxedWarning: Stop taking immediately if pregnant. Can cause injury or death to the developing fetus.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for hypertension, reducing stroke risk in hypertensive patients, and treating diabetic nephropathy.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take 50 mg once daily. Dose can be increased to 100 mg if needed.

drugs.description: An inhaler used to treat or prevent bronchospasm (narrowing of airways) in people with reversible obstructive airway disease.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Relaxes the muscles around the airways to allow easier breathing.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include throat irritation, viral infections, cough, and muscle pain.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for treatment/prevention of bronchospasm and exercise-induced bronchospasm.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: For oral inhalation only. Usually 2 inhalations every 4 to 6 hours, or 15-30 minutes before exercise.

drugs.description: Used to treat nerve pain caused by shingles and to treat partial seizures in epilepsy.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Affects chemicals and nerves in the body that are involved in the cause of seizures and some types of pain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, drowsiness, swelling, and fatigue.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for postherpetic neuralgia and as adjunctive therapy for partial onset seizures.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take orally with or without food. Dosage is titrated up, typically reaching a maintenance dose taken 3 times a day.

drugs.description: Relieves minor aches and pains (headache, backache, arthritis) and reduces fever.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.formula: Active ingredient (in each gelcap) Acetaminophen 500 mg
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Temporarily relieves minor aches/pains and reduces fever.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Adults take 2 gelcaps every 6 hours while symptoms last. Do not exceed 6 gelcaps in 24 hours.

drugs.description: An antidepressant used to treat major depressive disorder, OCD, panic disorder, PTSD, and social anxiety.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown, but thought to work by increasing serotonin activity in the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, diarrhea, insomnia, dry mouth, and sexual dysfunction.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased risk of suicidal thinking and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Major Depressive Disorder, OCD, Panic Disorder, PTSD, PMDD, and Social Anxiety Disorder.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take once daily, morning or evening. Usually starts at 50 mg/day.

drugs.description: Nasal spray for relieving symptoms of hay fever or other upper respiratory allergies like congestion and runny nose.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.formula: Active Ingredient (in each spray) Fluticasone propionate (glucocorticold) 50 mcg
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Temporarily relieves nasal congestion, sneezing, runny nose, and itchy/watery eyes.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Use once daily. Week 1: 2 sprays per nostril. Week 2+: 1 or 2 sprays per nostril as needed.

drugs.description: Used for chronic treatment of asthma and relief of allergic rhinitis (hay fever) symptoms.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Blocks substances in the body called leukotrienes that cause asthma and allergy symptoms.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include upper respiratory infection, fever, headache, stomach pain, and cough.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for asthma prophylaxis, prevention of exercise-induced bronchoconstriction, and allergic rhinitis.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take once daily in the evening. Dose depends on age (10 mg for adults, lower for children).

drugs.description: A diuretic (water pill) used to treat fluid retention (edema) and high blood pressure.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Can cause electrolyte loss, dehydration, low blood pressure, nausea, and dizziness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for edema associated with heart/liver/kidney disease and for hypertension.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dose is individualized. Edema: 20-80 mg single dose initially. Hypertension: 80 mg daily (divided doses).

drugs.description: A penicillin antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections like ear, throat, and skin infections.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Antibacterial drug that stops bacteria from forming cell walls.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include diarrhea, rash, vomiting, and nausea.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for infections of the ear, nose, throat, skin, urinary tract, and H. pylori infection.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usually taken every 8 to 12 hours. Dosage depends on severity of infection and age.

drugs.description: Used to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and conditions involving excess stomach acid.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Suppresses stomach acid production by blocking the acid pumps in the stomach lining.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, diarrhea, nausea, abdominal pain, and gas.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for GERD with erosive esophagitis and pathological hypersecretory conditions.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usually 40 mg once daily by IV or oral, for up to 10 days for GERD.

drugs.description: An antidepressant used to treat major depressive disorder and generalized anxiety disorder.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown, but increases serotonin levels in the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include insomnia, ejaculation disorder, nausea, increased sweating, and fatigue.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) and Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take 10 mg once daily, morning or evening, with or without food. Can increase to 20 mg.

drugs.description: A benzodiazepine used to treat generalized anxiety disorder and panic disorder.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Enhances the effect of GABA, a chemical in the brain that calms the nervous system.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include impaired coordination, low blood pressure, slurred speech, and increased libido.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risks include profound sedation, coma, death if used with opioids. High potential for abuse and addiction.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for acute treatment of Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD) and Panic Disorder.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosage varies; usually 0.25 to 0.5 mg three times daily to start.

drugs.description: A corticosteroid used to treat many conditions such as arthritis, severe allergies, and skin problems.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Can cause fluid retention, high blood pressure, muscle weakness, and mood changes.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for endocrine, rheumatic, collagen, dermatologic, allergic, ophthalmic, and respiratory disorders.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Initial dosage varies from 5 mg to 60 mg daily depending on the condition.

drugs.description: An antidepressant used to treat major depressive disorder and prevent seasonal affective disorder.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown, but likely affects norepinephrine and dopamine chemicals in the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dry mouth, nausea, insomnia, dizziness, and throat pain.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) and prevention of Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take once daily in the morning. Starting dose is usually 150 mg, increasing to 300 mg.

drugs.description: Used to lower cholesterol and reduce the risk of heart attack and stroke.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Blocks an enzyme in the liver that produces cholesterol.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include muscle pain, nausea, vomiting, upper respiratory infection, and diarrhea.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated to reduce heart risks and lower lipids/cholesterol in hyperlipidemia.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take orally once daily with or without food. Recommended starting dose is 40 to 80 mg.

drugs.description: An antidepressant used to treat major depressive disorder.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unclear, but presumed to potentiate serotonin activity in the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include ejaculation issues, nausea, sweating, fatigue, and drowsiness.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of Major Depressive Disorder (MDD).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take once daily with or without food. Initial dosage is 20 mg, max 40 mg.

drugs.description: A central nervous system stimulant used to treat Narcolepsy and ADHD.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include palpitations, rapid heart rate, insomnia, dry mouth, and weight loss.
drugs.boxedWarning: High potential for abuse and misuse which can lead to addiction, overdose, and death.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Narcolepsy, ADHD, and short-term obesity treatment.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosage is individually adjusted. Usually taken in divided doses; avoid late evening doses.

drugs.description: Relieves minor aches and pains due to headache, toothache, backache, and common cold.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.formula: Active ingredient (in each white tablet) Ibuprofen USP, 200 mg (NSAID)* *nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Temporarily relieves minor aches/pains and reduces fever.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Adults take 1 tablet every 4 to 6 hours while symptoms persist. Do not exceed 6 tablets in 24 hours.

drugs.description: A beta-blocker used to treat heart failure, high blood pressure, and after heart attacks.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Blocks certain receptors in the cardiovascular system to lower heart rate and blood pressure.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, fatigue, low blood pressure, diarrhea, and weight gain.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for mild to severe chronic heart failure, left ventricular dysfunction after MI, and hypertension.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take with food. Dosage is individualized and monitored during up-titration.

drugs.description: An antidepressant used to treat major depressive disorder.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Thought to enhance serotonin activity in the central nervous system.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include edema, blurred vision, fainting, drowsiness, fatigue, and diarrhea.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of Major Depressive Disorder (MDD).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Starting dose is 150 mg daily in divided doses. Can be increased by 50 mg every few days.

drugs.description: An antidepressant used for major depression, OCD, bulimia, and panic disorder.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Presumed to be linked to inhibition of CNS neuronal uptake of serotonin.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include abnormal dreams, anxiety, weakness, diarrhea, dry mouth, and sexual dysfunction.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for MDD, OCD, Bulimia Nervosa, and Panic Disorder.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usually 20 mg/day in the morning. Dosage varies by indication.

drugs.description: A strong painkiller (opioid) used to manage severe and persistent pain.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Binds to opioid receptors in the brain and inhibits reuptake of norepinephrine/serotonin to block pain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, constipation, nausea, headache, and drowsiness.
drugs.boxedWarning: Serious risks of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. Respiratory depression can occur.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for severe, persistent pain requiring an opioid when other treatments are inadequate.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take 100 mg once daily. Titrate up by 100 mg increments every 5 days if needed. Max 300 mg/day.

drugs.description: A rapid-acting insulin used to control high blood sugar in diabetes.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Lowers blood glucose by stimulating glucose uptake by muscles and fat.
drugs.sideEffects: Adverse reactions include low blood sugar (hypoglycemia), allergic reactions, injection site reactions, and rash.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated to improve glycemic control in adults and children with diabetes mellitus.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Inject subcutaneously within 15 minutes before or immediately after a meal.

drugs.description: Used to treat seizure disorders and panic disorder.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include drowsiness, ataxia (coordination problems), and behavior problems.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risks of profound sedation, coma, and death if used with opioids. High risk of abuse and addiction.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for seizure disorders (Lennox-Gastaut, akinetic, myoclonic) and Panic Disorder.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Swallow whole with water. Adults: Initial dose 1.5 mg/day (seizures) or 0.25 mg twice daily (panic).

drugs.description: Treats signs and symptoms of an enlarged prostate (Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Relaxes muscles in the prostate and bladder neck to improve urine flow.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, dizziness, runny nose, infection, and abnormal ejaculation.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of signs and symptoms of Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take 0.4 mg once daily, 30 minutes after the same meal each day. Do not crush or chew.

drugs.description: Used to treat high blood pressure and chest pain, and to reduce death risk after a heart attack.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include slow heart rate, cold extremities, dizziness, and tiredness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for hypertension, angina pectoris due to coronary atherosclerosis, and acute myocardial infarction.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Initial dose is usually 50 mg once daily. Can increase to 100 mg if needed.

drugs.description: Used to prevent or treat low levels of potassium in the blood (hypokalemia).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Restores potassium, which is essential for nerve impulses and muscle contraction.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, vomiting, gas, abdominal pain, and diarrhea.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for treatment and prophylaxis of hypokalemia.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take with meals and water. Swallow whole. Typical dose is 20-100 mEq per day.

drugs.description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to treat arthritis pain and inflammation.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Reduces inflammation and pain by inhibiting enzymes (COX-1 and COX-2) that produce prostaglandins.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include diarrhea, indigestion, flu-like symptoms, and upper respiratory infection.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risk of serious heart thrombotic events (stroke, heart attack) and serious stomach bleeding/ulcers.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Osteoarthritis (OA) and Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start with 7.5 mg once daily. Can be increased to 15 mg if needed.

drugs.description: Used to lower cholesterol and risk of cardiovascular disease.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Inhibits the enzyme in the liver responsible for producing cholesterol.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, nausea, muscle pain, weakness, and constipation.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated to reduce cardiovascular events and lower LDL cholesterol.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take orally once daily with or without food. Usual range is 5 to 40 mg.

drugs.description: Used to prevent blood clots in patients with heart conditions or after a stroke.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Prevents platelets in the blood from sticking together and forming clots.
drugs.sideEffects: The most common serious side effect is bleeding.
drugs.boxedWarning: Effectiveness depends on the body's ability to convert the drug; poor metabolizers may not get full benefit.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Acute Coronary Syndrome and recent heart attack/stroke.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take 75 mg once daily orally.

drugs.description: Treats high blood pressure, angina, migraines, and essential tremors.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include slow heart rate, heart failure symptoms, and light-headedness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for hypertension, angina, atrial fibrillation, post-MI, migraine, and tremor.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Individualized dose. Hypertension usually starts at 40 mg twice daily.

drugs.description: Used for temporary relief of minor aches and pains. Delayed action.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.formula: Active ingredient (in each tablet) Aspirin 81 mg (NSAID)* *nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Temporary relief of minor aches and pains.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Adults: 4 to 8 tablets every 4 hours. Do not exceed 48 tablets in 24 hours.

drugs.description: A muscle relaxant used with rest and physical therapy for muscle spasms.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include drowsiness, dry mouth, and fatigue.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for relief of muscle spasm associated with acute, painful musculoskeletal conditions.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Recommended dose is 5 mg three times a day. Max 10 mg three times a day. Limit use to 2-3 weeks.

drugs.description: Used to improve blood sugar control in adults with type 2 diabetes.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Stimulates the pancreas to release insulin, lowering blood glucose.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, diarrhea, and constipation. Hypoglycemia is a risk.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated as an adjunct to diet and exercise for type 2 diabetes mellitus.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start with 5 mg daily before breakfast. Adjust based on response.

drugs.description: Used to treat depression, anxiety, and nerve or muscle pain.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Believed to potentiate serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, dry mouth, sleepiness, constipation, and appetite loss.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Major Depressive Disorder, Generalized Anxiety Disorder, Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathic Pain, and Fibromyalgia.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take once daily with or without food. Swallow whole.

drugs.description: A central nervous system stimulant used to treat ADHD.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: A CNS stimulant; exact mode of therapeutic action in ADHD is unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, insomnia, stomach pain, and decreased appetite.
drugs.boxedWarning: High potential for abuse and dependence.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take orally once daily in the morning. Swallow whole or sprinkle on applesauce.

drugs.description: Relieves and prevents heartburn associated with acid indigestion.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.formula: Active ingredient (in each tablet) Ranitidine 150 mg (as ranitidine hydrochloride USP, 168 mg)
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Relieves and prevents heartburn associated with acid indigestion and sour stomach.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Swallow 1 tablet with water 30-60 minutes before eating food that causes heartburn. Max 2 tablets in 24 hours.

drugs.description: An antidepressant used to treat major depressive disorder, anxiety, and panic attacks.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Restores the balance of certain natural substances (serotonin and norepinephrine) in the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, drowsiness, dry mouth, sweating, and sexual dysfunction.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased risk of suicidal thinking and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of Major Depressive Disorder (MDD).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Starting dose is usually 75 mg/day, taken with food. Can be increased up to 225 mg/day.

drugs.description: A sedative used for the short-term treatment of insomnia (trouble falling asleep).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Increases the activity of GABA, a chemical in the brain that helps induce sleep.
drugs.sideEffects: Can cause drowsiness, dizziness, and complex sleep behaviors like sleep-walking or sleep-driving.
drugs.boxedWarning: Complex sleep behaviors (sleep-walking/driving) can result in serious injury or death.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the short-term treatment of insomnia characterized by difficulties with sleep initiation.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take immediately before bedtime with at least 7-8 hours remaining before waking. Max dose 10 mg.

drugs.description: A blood thinner used to prevent and treat blood clots in veins or arteries.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Blocks the formation of vitamin K-dependent clotting factors in the liver.
drugs.sideEffects: Major risk is bleeding, which can be fatal. bruising and tissue necrosis are also risks.
drugs.boxedWarning: Can cause major or fatal bleeding. Regular monitoring of INR (blood test) is required.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for prophylaxis and treatment of venous thrombosis, pulmonary embolism, and thromboembolic complications.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Highly individualized based on INR blood test results. Dosage changes based on diet and other meds.

drugs.description: A strong opioid pain medication used to treat severe pain when other treatments are not enough.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Binds to opioid receptors in the brain and spinal cord to alter the perception of pain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, constipation, vomiting, and sleepiness. High risk of addiction.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risks of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. Respiratory depression is a life-threatening risk.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the management of pain severe enough to require an opioid analgesic.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Use the lowest effective dosage for the shortest duration. Dosage is individualized based on pain severity.

drugs.description: An extended-cycle birth control pill used to prevent pregnancy.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Prevents pregnancy primarily by suppressing ovulation.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, heavier periods, nausea, acne, and weight gain.
drugs.boxedWarning: Cigarette smoking increases the risk of serious cardiovascular events. Contraindicated in women over 35 who smoke.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for use by females of reproductive potential to prevent pregnancy.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take one tablet daily for 91 days in the specific order directed on the wallet pack.

drugs.description: Used to treat gout, kidney stones, and high uric acid levels caused by cancer treatment.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Reduces the production of uric acid in the body by inhibiting the enzyme xanthine oxidase.
drugs.sideEffects: Most frequent side effect is skin rash. Nausea and diarrhea may also occur.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for gout, leukemia/lymphoma therapy-induced high uric acid, and recurrent calcium oxalate stones.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosage varies by condition. Gout usually starts at 100 mg daily, increasing weekly based on serum uric acid levels.

drugs.description: A high-dose Vitamin D supplement used to treat hypoparathyroidism and rickets.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Helps the body regulate calcium and phosphorus levels, essential for healthy bones.
drugs.sideEffects: Overdose causes toxicity: kidney problems, nausea, weakness, and calcification of soft tissues.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for hypoparathyroidism, refractory rickets, and familial hypophosphatemia.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dose is highly individualized under medical supervision. Range between 12,000 to 500,000 USP units daily.

drugs.description: Used to treat anxiety disorders and short-term relief of anxiety symptoms.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Works by calming the brain and nerves (central nervous system) by enhancing GABA effects.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include sedation, dizziness, weakness, and unsteadiness.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risks of profound sedation, coma, and death if used with opioids. Abuse and addiction potential.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the management of anxiety disorders or for the short-term relief of the symptoms of anxiety.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usual range is 2 to 6 mg/day given in divided doses. Dose is individualized.

drugs.description: An antipsychotic medication used to treat schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and depression.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Balances dopamine and serotonin in the brain to improve mood, thinking, and behavior.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include drowsiness, dry mouth, dizziness, constipation, and weight gain.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis. Increased suicidal thoughts in youth.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Schizophrenia, Bipolar I disorder (manic or depressive episodes).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Taken twice daily or once at bedtime. Dosage varies significantly by indication (150-800 mg/day).

drugs.description: A combination diuretic (water pill) used to treat high blood pressure and fluid retention (edema).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Helps the kidneys remove fluid and salt from the body while preventing potassium loss.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, dizziness, fatigue, and headache.
drugs.boxedWarning: Abnormal elevation of serum potassium levels (hyperkalemia) can occur, which may be fatal.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for hypertension or edema in patients who develop low potassium on other diuretics.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usually one or two tablets daily, given as a single dose.

drugs.description: Used with diet and exercise to treat type 2 diabetes.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Stimulates the pancreas to release more insulin, which lowers blood sugar.
drugs.sideEffects: Most common side effects are low blood sugar (hypoglycemia), headache, nausea, and dizziness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated as an adjunct to diet and exercise to improve glycemic control in adults with type 2 diabetes.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Recommended starting dose is 1 or 2 mg once daily with breakfast. Max dose is 8 mg.

drugs.description: A diuretic used to treat heart failure, high blood pressure, and fluid retention (edema).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Blocks aldosterone, a hormone that causes the body to retain salt and water.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include gynecomastia (breast growth in men), high potassium, and digestive issues.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for heart failure, hypertension, edema (cirrhosis/nephrotic syndrome), and primary hyperaldosteronism.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosage varies by condition. Heart failure often starts at 25 mg once daily.

drugs.description: Used to prevent nausea and vomiting caused by cancer chemotherapy, radiation, or surgery.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Blocks serotonin receptors that trigger the vomiting reflex.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, fatigue, constipation, and diarrhea.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for prevention of nausea/vomiting from chemotherapy, radiotherapy, and surgery.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Typically 8 mg to 24 mg depending on the cause (chemo/radiation/surgery).

drugs.description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain, swelling, and fever.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Reduces hormones (prostaglandins) that cause inflammation and pain in the body.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include stomach pain, indigestion, nausea, and headache.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risk of serious cardiovascular thrombotic events (heart attack/stroke) and serious GI bleeding/ulceration.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, acute pain, and dysmenorrhea.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Use lowest effective dose. Arthritis: 250-500 mg twice daily. Pain: 500 mg initially, then 250 mg.

drugs.description: Used to treat manic episodes of bipolar disorder, seizures (epilepsy), and to prevent migraine headaches.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Increases levels of GABA, a calming chemical in the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, headache, sleepiness, tremor, hair loss, and weight gain.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risks of liver failure (hepatotoxicity), birth defects (fetal risk), and pancreatitis.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for acute manic episodes in bipolar disorder, epilepsy (complex partial/absence seizures), and migraine prophylaxis.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dose varies by condition. Mania: start 25 mg/kg/day. Migraine: start 500 mg daily.

drugs.description: Used to treat male pattern hair loss in men only.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Blocks the enzyme that converts testosterone to DHT, a hormone that causes hair loss.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include decreased sex drive, erectile dysfunction, and ejaculation issues.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of male pattern hair loss (androgenetic alopecia) in MEN ONLY.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take one tablet (1 mg) orally once daily. Daily use for 3+ months needed for benefit.

drugs.description: An antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms like runny nose, sneezing, and itchy eyes.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Blocks the effects of histamine, a substance the body makes during allergic reactions.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.formula: Active ingredient (in each chewable tablet) Cetirizine HCl 2.5 mg
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Temporarily relieves symptoms of hay fever or other upper respiratory allergies.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Children 2-6 years: 1 tablet (2.5 mg) once daily. Children 6+: 2 tablets (5 mg) once daily.

drugs.description: Used to prevent seizures in epilepsy and to prevent migraine headaches.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Stabilizes nerve cells in the brain to prevent overactivity.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include tingling, loss of appetite, weight loss, dizziness, and memory problems.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Epilepsy (monotherapy or adjunctive) and preventive treatment of migraine.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Epilepsy: titrate to 200-400 mg/day. Migraine: titrate to 100 mg/day.

drugs.description: An antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections of the respiratory tract, skin, bone, and urinary tract.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Kills bacteria by preventing them from building their cell walls.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, and stomach pain.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for respiratory, otitis media, skin, bone, and genitourinary infections.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usually 250 mg every 6 hours or 500 mg every 12 hours for 7 to 14 days.

drugs.description: Treats frequent heartburn (occurring 2 or more days a week).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Reduces acid production in the stomach (Proton Pump Inhibitor).
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.formula: Active ingredient (in each tablet) Esomeprazole 20 mg (*Each delayed-release tablet corresponds to 22.25 mg esomeprazole magnesium, USP trihydrate)
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Treats frequent heartburn. Not intended for immediate relief.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take one tablet with water before eating in the morning for 14 days.

drugs.description: Eye drops used to lower high pressure inside the eye (glaucoma or ocular hypertension).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Increases the natural outflow of fluid from inside the eye.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include blurred vision, burning/stinging, redness, and changes in eyelash growth.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the reduction of elevated intraocular pressure in open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: One drop in the affected eye(s) once daily in the evening.

drugs.description: Used to treat osteoporosis (bone loss) in postmenopausal women and men.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Slows down bone loss and increases bone mass.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include stomach pain, acid reflux, constipation, and nausea.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for treatment of osteoporosis in postmenopausal women and to increase bone mass in men.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: 70 mg effervescent tablet dissolved in water once weekly. Take 30 mins before first food/drink. Do not lie down.

drugs.description: Used to treat anxiety, alcohol withdrawal symptoms, and muscle spasms.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Calms the brain and nerves by enhancing the effect of GABA.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include drowsiness, fatigue, and muscle weakness. Addiction risk.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risks of profound sedation, coma, and death if used with opioids. High risk of abuse and addiction.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for anxiety disorders, acute alcohol withdrawal, and skeletal muscle spasm.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Individualized. Anxiety: 2-10 mg, 2-4 times daily.

drugs.description: Treats nerve pain from diabetes or shingles, fibromyalgia, and certain seizures.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Calms damaged or overactive nerves that cause pain or seizures.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, sleepiness, dry mouth, swelling, and weight gain.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for neuropathic pain (diabetes, spinal cord injury), postherpetic neuralgia, fibromyalgia, and partial-onset seizures.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usually started at 150 mg/day in divided doses. Max dose varies by condition (300-600 mg).

drugs.genericName: METHYLPREDNISOLONE ACETATE, LIDOCAINE HYDROCHLORIDE, BUPIVACAINE HYDROCHLORIDE, POVIDINE IODINE, SODIUM CHLORIDE, ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL
drugs.description: A local anesthetic injection used to numb an area of the body during surgery or procedures.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Blocks nerve impulses that send pain signals to the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common reactions involve the nervous system and heart (restlessness, dizziness, tremors, low blood pressure).
drugs.boxedWarning: Risk of cardiac arrest, especially in obstetrical anesthesia (0.75% concentration).
drugs.formula: Active Ingredient Purpose Povidone Iodine 10% w/v (9.85% w/w/) Antiseptic
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for local or regional anesthesia/analgesia for surgery, dental procedures, and obstetrics.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosage varies greatly by procedure. Administered by a clinician. Not for spinal injection.

drugs.description: An antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections of the lungs, skin, kidneys, and bladder.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Stops bacteria from multiplying.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, headache, diarrhea, and insomnia. Serious risks like tendon rupture exist.
drugs.boxedWarning: Serious adverse reactions including tendinitis, tendon rupture, peripheral neuropathy, and CNS effects.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for pneumonia, skin infections, chronic bacterial prostatitis, inhalational anthrax, and plague.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usually 250 mg, 500 mg, or 750 mg orally every 24 hours.

drugs.description: Used to lower high cholesterol and triglyceride levels in the blood.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Helps the body break down fats and reduces production of triglycerides.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include abnormal liver tests, stomach pain, back pain, and headache.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated to reduce elevated LDL-C, Total-C, TG, and Apo B, and to increase HDL-C.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take 160 mg once daily with meals.

drugs.description: An antidepressant used to treat major depressive disorder.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Increases the release of mood-enhancing chemicals (norepinephrine and serotonin) in the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include sleepiness, increased appetite, weight gain, and dizziness.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of major depressive disorder (MDD).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Starting dose 15 mg once daily at bedtime. Can increase to 45 mg.

drugs.genericName: FERROUS FUMARATE AND POLYSACCHRIDE IRON COMPLEX AND FOLIC ACID
drugs.description: A supplement used to treat iron deficiency anemia and folic acid deficiency, especially during pregnancy.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Provides iron needed for red blood cells and folic acid for cell growth.
drugs.sideEffects: Can cause nausea, constipation, heartburn, and black stools.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for iron deficiency anemia, folate deficiency anemia, and pregnancy support.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: One capsule daily between meals. Avoid in children under 12.

drugs.description: An antipsychotic medication used to treat schizophrenia, bipolar mania, and irritability in autism.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Rebalances dopamine and serotonin to improve mood, thinking, and behavior.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include movement disorders (tremors), sleepiness, dizziness, anxiety, and weight gain.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Schizophrenia, Bipolar Mania, and Irritability associated with Autistic Disorder.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosage varies by condition. Schizophrenia adults: start 2 mg/day.

drugs.description: Used to treat epilepsy (seizures) and bipolar disorder.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Stabilizes electrical activity in the brain to prevent seizures and mood swings.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, headache, double vision, and nausea. Serious skin rashes can occur.
drugs.boxedWarning: Can cause serious, life-threatening skin rashes (Stevens-Johnson syndrome).
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Epilepsy (partial onset, generalized) and Bipolar I Disorder maintenance.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosing is complex and requires slow titration (starting low and increasing). Dosage depends on other meds taken.

drugs.description: Used to treat anxiety disorders.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Relieves anxiety without strong sedation, likely by affecting serotonin and dopamine receptors.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, nausea, headache, and nervousness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the management of anxiety disorders or the short-term relief of anxiety symptoms.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 15 mg daily (divided doses). Can increase by 5 mg every 2-3 days. Max 60 mg/day.

drugs.description: Used to treat confusion (dementia) related to mild, moderate, or severe Alzheimer's disease.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Increases levels of acetylcholine in the brain, a chemical important for memory and thinking.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, diarrhea, difficulty sleeping, vomiting, and muscle cramps.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of dementia of the Alzheimer's type.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 5 mg once daily at bedtime. Can increase to 10 mg after 4-6 weeks.

drugs.description: A short-acting muscle relaxant used to treat muscle stiffness (spasticity).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Blocks nerve impulses to the muscles to reduce tightness.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dry mouth, sleepiness, weakness, and dizziness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of spasticity.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 2 mg every 6-8 hours as needed. Max 3 doses/day. Max total 36 mg/day.

drugs.description: A central nervous system stimulant used to treat ADHD and moderate to severe binge eating disorder.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Increases levels of dopamine and norepinephrine in the brain to improve focus and impulse control.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include loss of appetite, insomnia, dry mouth, and anxiety.
drugs.boxedWarning: High potential for abuse and dependence.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for ADHD (6+ years) and moderate to severe Binge Eating Disorder (adults).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 30 mg once daily in the morning. Max dose 70 mg/day.

drugs.description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to treat arthritis pain and menstrual pain.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Reduces pain and inflammation by blocking the COX-2 enzyme.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include stomach pain, diarrhea, indigestion, and gas.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risk of serious cardiovascular thrombotic events (heart attack/stroke) and serious GI bleeding.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Osteoarthritis, Rheumatoid Arthritis, Ankylosing Spondylitis, Acute Pain, and Dysmenorrhea.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Osteoarthritis: 200 mg daily. Rheumatoid Arthritis: 100-200 mg twice daily.

drugs.description: An antipsychotic medication used to treat schizophrenia, tourette's disorder, and irritability in autism.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Balances dopamine and serotonin levels in the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, vomiting, constipation, headache, dizziness, and restlessness (akathisia).
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased mortality in elderly with dementia. Suicidal thoughts in children/young adults.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Schizophrenia, Irritability in Autistic Disorder, and Tourettes Disorder.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Schizophrenia adults: 10-15 mg/day once daily. Max 30 mg.

drugs.description: Used to treat overactive bladder symptoms like frequent or urgent urination and incontinence.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Relaxes the bladder muscle to prevent sudden contractions.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dry mouth, constipation, and dizziness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for overactive bladder with symptoms of urge urinary incontinence, urgency, and frequency.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 5 or 10 mg once daily. Max 30 mg/day. Swallow whole.

drugs.description: An antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections, acne, and prevent malaria.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Stops bacteria from growing by inhibiting protein synthesis.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and sensitivity to sunlight.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Rickettsial infections, respiratory infections, STDs, acne, and malaria prophylaxis.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usually 200 mg on day 1, then 100 mg daily. Severe infections: 100 mg every 12 hours.

drugs.genericName: ASCORBIC ACID, CHOLECALCIFEROL, .ALPHA.-TOCOPHEROL ACETATE, DL-, PYRIDOXINE, FOLIC ACID, CYANOCOBALAMIN, CALCIUM, FERROUS FUMARATE, MAGNESIUM, DOCONEXENT
drugs.description: A prenatal multivitamin supplement to support nutritional needs before, during, and after pregnancy.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Provides essential vitamins and minerals.
drugs.sideEffects: May cause allergic sensitization.
drugs.boxedWarning: Accidental overdose of iron-containing products is a leading cause of fatal poisoning in children under 6.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for use in the dietary management of patients with nutritional deficiencies.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: One softgel daily or as directed by a physician.

drugs.description: Used to treat high blood pressure (essential hypertension), often with other medications.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Relaxes blood vessels (vasodilator) to help blood flow more easily.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, rapid heart rate, and loss of appetite.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for essential hypertension, alone or as an adjunct.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start low (10 mg four times daily) and increase gradually based on response.

drugs.description: Used to treat chronic heart failure in adults and children to reduce the risk of death and hospitalization.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Combines a neprilysin inhibitor and an ARB to relax blood vessels and reduce fluid buildup.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include low blood pressure, high potassium, and kidney problems.
drugs.boxedWarning: Stop taking immediately if pregnant. Can cause injury or death to the developing fetus.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated to reduce cardiovascular death and hospitalization for heart failure.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take twice daily. Starting dose depends on previous medication history.

drugs.description: Used to lower cholesterol and reduce the risk of heart attacks and angina.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, an enzyme needed for cholesterol production in the liver.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include muscle pain, stomach pain, and gas. Can cause serious muscle problems.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated to lower total and LDL cholesterol and prevent coronary heart disease.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take with the evening meal. Usual starting dose is 20 mg once daily.

drugs.description: Used to treat high blood pressure and chronic stable angina (chest pain).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: A calcium channel blocker that relaxes blood vessels and slows the heart rate.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include swelling (edema), headache, dizziness, and slow heart rate.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of hypertension and management of chronic stable angina.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take once daily. Dosage is adjusted based on patient need, typically starting at 180-240 mg.

drugs.description: Treats ulcers, GERD (acid reflux), and conditions with excess stomach acid.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Reduces the amount of acid produced by the stomach by blocking histamine-2 receptors.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, dizziness, constipation, and diarrhea.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for active duodenal/gastric ulcers, GERD, and pathological hypersecretory conditions.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usually taken once daily at bedtime or twice daily. 20 mg or 40 mg depending on condition.

drugs.description: An antibiotic used to treat various infections including Trichomoniasis and anaerobic bacterial infections.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown, but effective against certain bacteria and protozoa.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, headache, metallic taste, and genital itching.
drugs.boxedWarning: Has been shown to cause cancer in mice/rats. Avoid unnecessary use.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Trichomoniasis, Amebiasis, and anaerobic bacterial infections.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosage varies by infection. Trichomoniasis: One-day (2g) or seven-day (250mg 3x daily) course.

drugs.description: A tricyclic antidepressant used to relieve symptoms of depression.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dry mouth, drowsiness, dizziness, and weight gain.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased risk of suicidal thinking and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the relief of symptoms of depression.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start low (e.g., 75 mg/day) and increase gradually. Often taken at bedtime due to sedation.

drugs.description: Used to treat partial-onset seizures, myoclonic seizures, and primary generalized tonic-clonic seizures.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Exact mechanism unknown; binds to SV2A protein in the brain which may suppress seizures.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include sleepiness, weakness, infection, and dizziness. Can cause behavioral changes.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for partial-onset, myoclonic, and primary generalized tonic-clonic seizures.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usually taken twice daily. Adults start at 500 mg twice daily (1000 mg/day).

drugs.description: Used to treat vasospastic angina, chronic stable angina, and high blood pressure.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Relaxes blood vessels and reduces the heart's workload by blocking calcium influx.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include swelling (edema), headache, fatigue, and dizziness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Vasospastic Angina, Chronic Stable Angina, and Hypertension.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Swallow whole. Start with 30 or 60 mg once daily. Titrate over 7-14 days.

drugs.description: Treats high blood pressure and heart failure after a heart attack to reduce risk of death.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Inhibits ACE, lowering production of angiotensin II, which relaxes blood vessels.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, dizziness, fatigue, and persistent cough.
drugs.boxedWarning: Stop taking immediately if pregnant. Can cause injury or death to the developing fetus.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for hypertension and heart failure post-myocardial infarction.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Hypertension: Start 2.5 mg once daily. Post-MI Heart Failure: Start 2.5 mg twice daily.

drugs.description: Used for the symptomatic relief of cough.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Numbs the stretch receptors in the lungs to reduce the urge to cough.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include sedation, headache, dizziness, and constipation.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the symptomatic relief of cough.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Swallow whole. Do not chew. Usual dose is 100 mg or 200 mg three times a day.

drugs.description: Used to treat moderate to severe dementia of the Alzheimer's type.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Regulates glutamate activity in the brain by blocking NMDA receptors.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, headache, confusion, and constipation.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of moderate to severe dementia of the Alzheimers type.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 5 mg once daily. Increase by 5 mg increments weekly to target 20 mg/day.

drugs.description: Injection used to treat acute migraine and cluster headaches.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Narrows blood vessels in the brain and reduces release of substances that cause pain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include injection site reactions, tingling, dizziness, and warm sensations.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for acute treatment of migraine (with/without aura) and cluster headache.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Subcutaneous injection. Single dose 6 mg. Max 12 mg in 24 hours.

drugs.description: Used to treat certain cancers, severe rheumatoid arthritis, and severe psoriasis.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Interferes with DNA synthesis and cell reproduction.
drugs.sideEffects: Can cause mouth sores, low white blood cell count, nausea, and stomach distress.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risk of fetal death/toxicity, severe hypersensitivity, and severe organ damage (liver, lung, kidney, bone marrow).
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for ALL (leukemia), mycosis fungoides, NHL, Rheumatoid Arthritis, pJIA, and Psoriasis.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Highly variable. RA: 7.5 mg orally once weekly. Psoriasis: 10-25 mg once weekly.

drugs.brandName: Foster and Thrive Dry Eye Relief
drugs.description: Eye drops used to relieve burning and irritation due to dryness of the eye.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Used for protection and relief of dry eye irritation.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Instill 1 to 2 drops in the affected eye(s) as needed.

drugs.description: Muscle relaxant used to treat spasticity from multiple sclerosis or spinal cord injuries.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Most common side effects include drowsiness, dizziness, and weakness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for spasticity resulting from multiple sclerosis or spinal cord conditions.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start with 5 mg 3 times daily. Increase gradually to optimum effect. Max 80 mg daily.

drugs.description: Used to treat anxiety and itching caused by allergic conditions. Also used as a sedative.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dry mouth and drowsiness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for anxiety, pruritus (itching), and as a pre-operative sedative.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Adults: 50-100 mg 4 times daily for anxiety. 25 mg 3-4 times daily for itching.

drugs.description: Opioid combination used for mild to moderate pain when other treatments are not enough.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include drowsiness, lightheadedness, dizziness, and shortness of breath.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risks of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, death, and respiratory depression.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for mild to moderate pain where opioid treatment is appropriate.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosage adjusted to severity of pain. Typical adult dose is 1-2 tablets every 4 hours.

drugs.description: Antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown; efficacy likely due to dopamine and serotonin antagonism.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, constipation, weight gain, and dry mouth.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Schizophrenia and Bipolar I Disorder (manic/mixed episodes).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Schizophrenia: Start 5-10 mg daily. Bipolar I: Start 10-15 mg daily.

drugs.description: Used to treat overactive bladder symptoms like frequent or urgent urination and incontinence.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Blocks bladder contractions by acting as an antagonist at muscarinic receptors.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dry mouth, headache, constipation, and abdominal pain.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for overactive bladder with symptoms of urge urinary incontinence, urgency, and frequency.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: 4 mg capsule once daily. Swallow whole. May decrease to 2 mg based on response.

drugs.description: Short-term adjunct for weight loss in obesity, used with exercise and diet.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Stimulates the central nervous system to suppress appetite.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include heart palpitations, insomnia, dry mouth, and high blood pressure.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for exogenous obesity as a short-term adjunct to weight reduction regimen.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Individualized dosage. Usual adult dose is 37.5 mg daily before breakfast.

drugs.description: Used to treat angina, heart rhythm disorders (arrhythmias), and high blood pressure.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include constipation, dizziness, nausea, and low blood pressure.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Angina, Arrhythmias, and Essential Hypertension.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Individualized by titration. Angina/HTN often start at 80 mg 3x daily.

drugs.description: Used to treat allergies, motion sickness, nausea/vomiting, and for sedation.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include drowsiness, dizziness, and dry mouth. Severe respiratory depression risks.
drugs.boxedWarning: Do not use in children under 2 years due to potential for fatal respiratory depression.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for allergies, motion sickness, nausea/vomiting, and sedation.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Contraindicated in <2 years. Allergy: 25 mg at bedtime. Nausea: 25 mg. Rectal suppository.

drugs.description: Used to treat very high triglycerides to reduce the risk of pancreatitis.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include indigestion, stomach pain, and diarrhea.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for treatment of adult patients with very high serum triglyceride levels (Types IV and V).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: 1,200 mg daily in two divided doses, 30 minutes before morning and evening meals.

drugs.description: An antibiotic used to treat urinary tract infections (UTIs).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Kills bacteria.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, vomiting, and loss of appetite. Can cause lung and liver problems.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for treatment of urinary tract infections due to susceptible bacterial strains.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Adults: 50-100 mg four times a day with food.

drugs.description: Antiviral used to treat and prevent influenza (flu) A and B.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Inhibits the influenza virus neuraminidase enzyme.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, vomiting, and headache.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for treatment and prophylaxis of acute, uncomplicated influenza A and B.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Treatment: 75 mg twice daily for 5 days. Prophylaxis: 75 mg once daily for 10 days.

drugs.description: Antiviral used to treat cold sores, genital herpes, and shingles (herpes zoster).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Inhibits viral DNA replication.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, nausea, and abdominal pain.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Cold Sores, Genital Herpes (treatment/suppression), and Herpes Zoster.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dose varies by condition. Cold sores: 2 grams every 12 hours for 1 day.

drugs.description: Topical antibiotic cream for treating skin infections like impetigo.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Inhibits bacterial protein synthesis.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, rash, and nausea. Local irritation.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for secondarily infected traumatic skin lesions due to S. aureus and S. pyogenes.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Apply small amount to affected area 3 times daily for 10 days.

drugs.description: Used to treat symptoms of an enlarged prostate (BPH) and high blood pressure.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include fatigue, malaise, low blood pressure, and dizziness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) and Hypertension.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 1 mg once daily. Titrate up to 8 mg (BPH) or 16 mg (Hypertension) as needed.

drugs.description: An antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections and severe acne.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Bacteriostatic antibiotic that inhibits protein synthesis.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include fever, discoloration of secretions, and GI upset.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for various infections (Rickettsial, respiratory, STDs) and acne.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usual dose 200 mg initially followed by 100 mg every 12 hours.

drugs.description: Used to treat erectile dysfunction (ED).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Increases blood flow to the penis by inhibiting the enzyme PDE5.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, flushing, upset stomach, and vision changes.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of erectile dysfunction.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take 50 mg about 1 hour before sexual activity. Dose can be adjusted (25-100 mg).

drugs.description: Topical lotion used to treat acne vulgaris.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown in treating acne.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include burning, itching, and dryness of the skin.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of acne vulgaris.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Apply thin film to affected area twice daily. Shake well before use.

drugs.description: Used to treat Parkinson's disease and Restless Legs Syndrome (RLS).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Stimulates dopamine receptors in the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, sleepiness, dizziness, and vomiting.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Parkinsons disease and moderate-to-severe primary Restless Legs Syndrome (RLS).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: PD: Start 0.25 mg 3x daily. RLS: Start 0.25 mg once daily before bed. Titrate up.

drugs.description: A corticosteroid used to induce remission in active, mild to moderate ulcerative colitis.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Anti-inflammatory corticosteroid.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, nausea, fatigue, and acne.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the induction of remission in active, mild to moderate ulcerative colitis.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: 9 mg tablet once daily in the morning for up to 8 weeks. Swallow whole.

drugs.description: Antiseptic handwash for healthcare personnel to reduce bacteria.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Healthcare personnel handwash to help reduce bacteria.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Wet hands, apply 5 mL, wash vigorously for 30 seconds, rinse and dry.

drugs.description: Topical powder used to treat fungal skin infections caused by Candida.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Adverse events are rare (less than 0.1%), may include burning or itching.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for cutaneous or mucocutaneous mycotic infections caused by Candida albicans.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Apply to lesions 2-3 times daily until healed. Dust on feet/shoes for foot infections.

drugs.description: Topical gel for temporary relief of arthritis pain in hands, wrists, elbows, feet, ankles, and knees.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.formula: Active ingredient Diclofenac sodium (NSAID*) 1% (equivalent to 0.93% diclofenac) *nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Temporary relief of arthritis pain in specific upper and lower body areas.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Use 4 times/day. Use dosing card: 2g for upper body areas, 4g for lower body areas.

drugs.description: Used for the short-term treatment of insomnia (trouble sleeping).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include drowsiness, headache, fatigue, and nervousness.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risks of profound sedation, coma, and death if used with opioids. Abuse and addiction potential.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for short-term treatment of insomnia (generally 7-10 days).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take 15 mg before retiring (7.5 mg or 30 mg may be used).

drugs.description: Relieves itching from skin irritations like eczema, insect bites, and poison ivy.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Temporarily relieves itching associated with minor skin irritations and rashes.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Apply to affected area not more than 3 to 4 times daily.

drugs.description: Used to treat functional bowel or irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Relieves muscle spasms in the gastrointestinal tract.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dry mouth, dizziness, blurred vision, and nausea.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of functional bowel/irritable bowel syndrome.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start with 20 mg four times a day. Can increase to 40 mg if needed.

drugs.description: An antiviral drug used to treat shingles, genital herpes, and chickenpox.
drugs.category: Herpes Simplex Virus Nucleoside Analog DNA Polymerase Inhibitor [EPC]
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Stops the virus from replicating its DNA, preventing it from spreading.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and malaise.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Herpes Zoster (shingles), Genital Herpes, and Chickenpox.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dose varies by condition. Shingles: 800 mg 5 times daily for 7-10 days.

drugs.description: Used to prevent chest pain (angina) caused by heart disease.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Relaxes blood vessels, making it easier for the heart to pump blood.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache (often dose-related) and dizziness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the prevention of angina pectoris. Not for acute attacks.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take once daily in the morning. Swallow whole, do not chew.

drugs.description: Used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: An ACE inhibitor that relaxes blood vessels to lower blood pressure.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, cough, and dizziness.
drugs.boxedWarning: Stop taking immediately if pregnant. Can cause injury or death to the developing fetus.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of hypertension.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usually started at 10 mg once daily. Can be titrated up to 40 mg.

drugs.description: A combination birth control pill used to prevent pregnancy.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Prevents pregnancy primarily by suppressing ovulation.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, nausea, breast tenderness, and mood changes.
drugs.boxedWarning: Cigarette smoking increases cardiovascular risk. Contraindicated in women over 35 who smoke.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for use by females of reproductive potential to prevent pregnancy.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take one tablet daily at the same time every day.

drugs.description: Used to treat seizures (epilepsy) and nerve pain (trigeminal neuralgia).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Reduces abnormal electrical activity in the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, drowsiness, and nausea. Serious skin and blood reactions can occur.
drugs.boxedWarning: Serious dermatologic reactions (TEN/SJS) and aplastic anemia/agranulocytosis risk.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for epilepsy (partial, generalized tonic-clonic) and trigeminal neuralgia.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start low (200 mg twice daily) and increase gradually. Take with food.

drugs.description: A topical patch used for temporary relief of pain.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Numbs the skin and underlying tissues to relieve pain.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.formula: ACTIVE INGREDIENTS: Lidocaine 4.00% Menthol 1.00% Topical Anesthetic External Analgesic
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: For temporary relief of pain.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Apply patch to affected area for up to 8 hours. Max 4 patches/day.

drugs.description: A tricyclic antidepressant used to relieve symptoms of depression.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include low blood pressure, confusion, dry mouth, and blurred vision.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased risk of suicidal thinking and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the relief of symptoms of depression.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usual adult dose is 25 mg 3-4 times daily. Dosage is individualized.

drugs.description: A topical corticosteroid cream used to relieve skin inflammation and itching.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Has anti-inflammatory, antipruritic, and vasoconstrictive properties.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include burning, itching, and skin thinning (atrophy).
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for inflammatory and pruritic manifestations of corticosteroid-responsive dermatoses.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Apply a thin film to affected skin areas once daily.

drugs.description: A beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Lowers blood pressure by decreasing heart rate and relaxing blood vessels.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, fatigue, and dizziness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of hypertension.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start at 5 mg once daily. Can be increased up to 40 mg.

drugs.description: Used with diet and exercise to treat type 2 diabetes.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Stimulates the pancreas to release more insulin.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, heartburn, and skin reactions. Risk of low blood sugar.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated as an adjunct to diet and exercise to improve glycemic control in type 2 diabetes.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usual starting dose is 2.5 to 5 mg daily with breakfast.

drugs.description: Injectable birth control (Depo-Provera) used to prevent pregnancy.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Inhibits ovulation and thickens cervical mucus to prevent pregnancy.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include menstrual irregularities, weight gain, and headache.
drugs.boxedWarning: May cause significant loss of bone mineral density. Long-term use (>2 years) not recommended.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for prevention of pregnancy.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: 150 mg intramuscular injection every 3 months.

drugs.description: Used to treat malaria, rheumatoid arthritis, and lupus.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Antimalarial and antirheumatic agent; exact mechanism in autoimmune disease unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea and stomach pain. Serious risks include retinal toxicity.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Malaria, Rheumatoid Arthritis, and Systemic/Discoid Lupus Erythematosus.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosage varies by condition. Lupus/RA usually 200-400 mg daily.

drugs.description: Used to treat seizures (epilepsy).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Increases brain concentrations of GABA to prevent seizures.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, headache, tremor, and hair loss.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risks of fatal liver failure, birth defects (fetal risk), and pancreatitis.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for complex partial seizures and absence seizures.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 10-15 mg/kg/day. Increase weekly to achieve control. Take with food.

drugs.description: An antibiotic used to treat respiratory, skin, and H. pylori infections.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Inhibits bacterial protein synthesis.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include stomach pain, diarrhea, nausea, and bad taste in mouth.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for bronchitis, sinusitis, pneumonia, skin infections, and H. pylori.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usually 250-500 mg every 12 hours for 7-14 days.

drugs.description: Used to treat and prevent duodenal ulcers by forming a protective coating.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Forms a barrier over ulcers to protect them from acid.
drugs.sideEffects: Constipation is the most common side effect.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for short-term treatment and maintenance of duodenal ulcers.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: 1 gram four times a day on an empty stomach.

drugs.description: Used to treat heart failure and irregular heartbeats (atrial fibrillation).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Increases the force of heart contractions and controls heart rate.
drugs.sideEffects: Toxicity is a risk; symptoms include nausea, dizziness, and visual disturbances.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for mild to moderate heart failure and atrial fibrillation.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Highly specific based on patient weight, age, and renal function.

drugs.description: Shampoo used to treat fungal skin infection (tinea versicolor).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Generally well tolerated; rare irritation or hair texture changes.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of tinea versicolor.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Apply to damp skin, lather, leave for 5 minutes, then rinse. Single application often sufficient.

drugs.description: Used to treat high blood pressure.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Relaxes blood vessels to lower blood pressure.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, drowsiness, lack of energy, and palpitations.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of hypertension.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 1 mg 2-3 times daily. Titrate slowly to maintenance dose (up to 20 mg daily).

drugs.description: Muscle relaxant used for relief of discomfort from acute, painful musculoskeletal conditions.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown, possibly sedative.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, drowsiness, and lightheadedness.
