drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated as an adjunct to rest/therapy for acute, painful musculoskeletal conditions.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Adults: Initial 1.5g four times daily. Maintenance 1g four times daily.

drugs.description: Long-acting penicillin antibiotic injection used to treat syphilis and other infections.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Kills bacteria by inhibiting cell wall synthesis.
drugs.sideEffects: Allergic reactions are the main risk. Injection site pain.
drugs.boxedWarning: NOT FOR INTRAVENOUS USE. Intravenous injection can cause cardiac arrest and death.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for mild-to-moderate upper respiratory infections, Syphilis, Yaws, and Rheumatic fever prophylaxis.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Deep intramuscular injection only. Dosage varies by infection.

drugs.description: Used to treat life-threatening heart rhythm problems (ventricular fibrillation/tachycardia).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Prolongs the cardiac action potential and refractory period to stabilize heart rhythm.
drugs.sideEffects: High toxicity risk: lung damage, liver injury, vision loss, and worsened arrhythmias.
drugs.boxedWarning: Pulmonary, Hepatic, and Cardiac Toxicity. Use only for life-threatening arrhythmias.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for recurrent ventricular fibrillation and hemodynamically unstable ventricular tachycardia.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Loading dose 800-1600 mg/day, reduced gradually to maintenance dose of ~400 mg/day.

drugs.description: Antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar depression.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include sleepiness, restlessness (akathisia), nausea, and movement disorders.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis. Suicidal thoughts in young people.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Schizophrenia and Bipolar Depression.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take with food (at least 350 calories). Start 40 mg (Schizophrenia) or 20 mg (Bipolar) daily.

drugs.description: Used to treat symptoms of enlarged prostate (BPH) and high blood pressure.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include weakness (asthenia), dizziness, and postural hypotension.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for symptomatic Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) and Hypertension.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 1 mg at bedtime. Titrate slowly up to 10 mg (BPH) or higher for hypertension.

drugs.description: Used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: ACE inhibitor; relaxes blood vessels and lowers blood pressure.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include fatigue, dizziness, and cough.
drugs.boxedWarning: Stop taking immediately if pregnant. Can cause injury or death to the developing fetus.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Hypertension, Heart Failure, and Asymptomatic Left Ventricular Dysfunction.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 2.5 to 5 mg daily. Titrate up to maintenance dose.

drugs.description: Eye drops used to reduce pressure in the eye in patients with glaucoma.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Combines a carbonic anhydrase inhibitor and a beta-blocker to reduce eye fluid production.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include bitter taste, eye burning/stinging, and blurred vision.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for reduction of elevated intraocular pressure in open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: One drop in affected eye(s) two times daily.

drugs.description: Used with diet and exercise to treat type 2 diabetes.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Increases insulin sensitivity in the body.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include upper respiratory infection, headache, and sinus infection.
drugs.boxedWarning: Can cause or worsen congestive heart failure.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated as an adjunct to diet and exercise to improve glycemic control in type 2 diabetes.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 15 mg or 30 mg once daily. Max 45 mg.

drugs.description: Used to treat Parkinson's disease symptoms and drug-induced movement disorders.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include fast heart rate, constipation, nausea, and dry mouth.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for all forms of parkinsonism and drug-induced extrapyramidal disorders.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start low (0.5 to 1 mg) at bedtime. Increase gradually.

drugs.description: Used to prevent and treat nausea, vomiting, or dizziness from motion sickness.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Prevention and treatment of nausea/vomiting/dizziness associated with motion sickness.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take 1-2 tablets one hour before travel.

drugs.description: Information not provided in source.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.

drugs.description: Used to control seizures (epilepsy).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include ataxia (clumsiness) and vertigo.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for control of grand mal, psychomotor, and focal epileptic seizures.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Adults: Maintenance 250 mg 3-4 times daily. Start slow.

drugs.description: Used to treat life-threatening heart rhythm problems and atrial fibrillation.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Has both beta-blocking and cardiac action potential duration prolongation properties.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include fatigue, slow heart rate, and shortness of breath.
drugs.boxedWarning: Can cause life-threatening ventricular tachycardia. Initiate in a facility with cardiac monitoring.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias and maintenance of normal sinus rhythm in AFIB/AFL.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 80 mg twice daily. Adjust based on kidney function.

drugs.description: Used to prevent and treat gout flares and Familial Mediterranean Fever.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Disrupts inflammatory cell function to reduce gout symptoms.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include diarrhea and throat pain. Gastrointestinal effects are common.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for prophylaxis and treatment of gout flares, and Familial Mediterranean fever.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Gout flare: 1.2 mg at first sign, then 0.6 mg one hour later.

drugs.description: Potent opioid suppository used for severe pain when other treatments fail.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Binds to opioid receptors in the brain to block pain signals.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, sedation, nausea, and vomiting.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risks of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, death, and respiratory depression.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for management of pain severe enough to require an opioid analgesic.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: One 3 mg suppository every 6 to 8 hours.

drugs.description: Used to treat acute migraine headaches with or without aura.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Narrows blood vessels in the brain to relieve migraine pain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include fatigue, sleepiness, and pain/pressure sensation.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for acute treatment of migraine with or without aura.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Single dose of 5 or 10 mg. Can repeat after 2 hours if needed. Max 30 mg/24 hours.

drugs.description: Used to treat high blood pressure (essential hypertension), often in combination with other drugs.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Relaxes blood vessels (vasodilator) to allow blood to flow more easily.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, loss of appetite, nausea, and rapid heart rate.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for essential hypertension, alone or as an adjunct.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start with 10 mg four times daily; increase dosage gradually based on response.

drugs.description: Used to treat chronic heart failure in adults and children to reduce the risk of death and hospitalization.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Combines a neprilysin inhibitor and an ARB to relax blood vessels and reduce sodium/fluid retention.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include low blood pressure, high potassium, cough, and dizziness.
drugs.boxedWarning: Stop taking immediately if pregnant. Can cause injury or death to the developing fetus.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated to reduce the risk of cardiovascular death and hospitalization for heart failure.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Adult starting dose is usually 49/51 mg twice daily. Maintenance dose is 97/103 mg twice daily.

drugs.description: Used to lower cholesterol levels and reduce the risk of heart attacks and chest pain.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Inhibits the enzyme responsible for cholesterol synthesis in the liver.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include muscle pain, stomach pain, gas, and constipation.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated to reduce risk of coronary heart disease and lower cholesterol levels.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take with the evening meal. Usual starting dose is 20 mg once daily.

drugs.description: Used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and chronic stable angina (chest pain).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Calcium channel blocker that relaxes blood vessels and slows the heart rate.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include swelling (edema), headache, dizziness, and slow heart rate.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of hypertension and management of chronic stable angina.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Extended-release capsules taken once daily. Dosage is adjusted based on patient need.

drugs.description: Treats ulcers, GERD, and conditions causing excess stomach acid.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Reduces the amount of acid produced by the stomach.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, dizziness, constipation, and diarrhea.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for active duodenal/gastric ulcers, GERD, and pathological hypersecretory conditions.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usually taken once daily at bedtime or twice daily. 20 mg or 40 mg.

drugs.description: Antibiotic used to treat various infections including Trichomoniasis and anaerobic bacterial infections.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Disrupts DNA in bacteria and protozoa, killing the organisms.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, headache, metallic taste, and genital itching.
drugs.boxedWarning: Shown to be carcinogenic in mice/rats. Avoid unnecessary use.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Trichomoniasis, Amebiasis, and anaerobic bacterial infections.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosage varies by infection. Trichomoniasis: 2g single dose or 250mg 3x daily for 7 days.

drugs.description: A tricyclic antidepressant used to relieve symptoms of depression.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Restores the balance of neurotransmitters (serotonin and norepinephrine) in the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dry mouth, drowsiness, dizziness, constipation, and weight gain.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased risk of suicidal thinking and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the relief of symptoms of depression.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start at a low level (e.g., 75 mg/day) and increase gradually. Often taken at bedtime.

drugs.description: Used to treat partial-onset, myoclonic, and primary generalized tonic-clonic seizures.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Exact mechanism unknown; binds to SV2A protein in the brain which may reduce seizure activity.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include sleepiness, weakness, infection, and dizziness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for partial-onset, myoclonic, and primary generalized tonic-clonic seizures.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Adults usually start at 500 mg twice daily. Dosage adjusted based on response.

drugs.description: Used to treat vasospastic angina, chronic stable angina, and high blood pressure.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Relaxes blood vessels and reduces the heart's workload by blocking calcium.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include swelling (edema), headache, fatigue, and dizziness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Vasospastic Angina, Chronic Stable Angina, and Hypertension.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Swallow whole. Start with 30 or 60 mg once daily. Titrate over 7-14 days.

drugs.description: Treats high blood pressure and improves survival after a heart attack with heart failure.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: ACE inhibitor; relaxes blood vessels and lowers blood pressure.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, dizziness, fatigue, and dry cough.
drugs.boxedWarning: Stop taking immediately if pregnant. Can cause injury or death to the developing fetus.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for hypertension and heart failure post-myocardial infarction.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Hypertension: Start 2.5 mg once daily. Post-MI Heart Failure: Start 2.5 mg twice daily.

drugs.description: Used for the symptomatic relief of cough.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Numbs the stretch receptors in the lungs to reduce the urge to cough.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include sedation, headache, dizziness, and constipation.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the symptomatic relief of cough.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Swallow whole. Do not chew. Usual dose is 100 mg or 200 mg three times a day.

drugs.description: Used to treat moderate to severe dementia of the Alzheimer's type.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Regulates glutamate activity in the brain to support memory and learning.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, headache, confusion, and constipation.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of moderate to severe dementia of the Alzheimers type.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 5 mg once daily. Increase by 5 mg increments weekly to target 20 mg/day.

drugs.description: Injection used to treat acute migraine and cluster headaches.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Narrows blood vessels in the brain and reduces release of substances that cause pain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include injection site reactions, tingling, dizziness, and flushing.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for acute treatment of migraine (with/without aura) and cluster headache.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Subcutaneous injection. Single dose 6 mg. Max 12 mg in 24 hours.

drugs.description: Used to treat certain cancers, severe rheumatoid arthritis, and severe psoriasis.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Interferes with cell growth by blocking folic acid metabolism.
drugs.sideEffects: Can cause mouth sores, low white blood cell count, nausea, and abdominal distress.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risks of fetal death, severe hypersensitivity, and severe organ damage (liver, lung, kidney).
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Leukemia (ALL), Lymphoma, Rheumatoid Arthritis, and Psoriasis.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosing is highly specific. RA/Psoriasis: often taken once weekly (e.g., 7.5 to 25 mg).

drugs.brandName: Foster and Thrive Dry Eye Relief
drugs.description: Eye drops used to relieve burning and irritation due to dryness of the eye.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Lubricates the eye surface.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Used for protection and relief of dry eye irritation.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Instill 1 to 2 drops in the affected eye(s) as needed.

drugs.description: Muscle relaxant used to treat spasticity from multiple sclerosis or spinal cord injuries.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Reduces the transmission of impulses from the spinal cord to skeletal muscle.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include drowsiness, dizziness, weakness, and fatigue.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for spasticity resulting from multiple sclerosis or spinal cord conditions.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start with 5 mg 3 times daily. Increase gradually. Max 80 mg daily.

drugs.description: Used to treat anxiety and itching caused by allergic conditions. Also used as a sedative.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Suppresses activity in certain regions of the subcortical area of the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dry mouth and drowsiness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for anxiety, pruritus (itching), and as a pre-operative sedative.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Adults: 50-100 mg 4 times daily for anxiety. 25 mg 3-4 times daily for itching.

drugs.description: Opioid combination used for mild to moderate pain when other treatments are not enough.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Combines a pain reliever/fever reducer with an opioid agonist.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include drowsiness, lightheadedness, dizziness, and shortness of breath.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risks of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, death, and respiratory depression.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for mild to moderate pain where opioid treatment is appropriate.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dosage adjusted to severity of pain. Typical adult dose is 1-2 tablets every 4 hours.

drugs.description: Antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown; efficacy likely due to dopamine and serotonin antagonism.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dizziness, constipation, weight gain, and dry mouth.
drugs.boxedWarning: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Schizophrenia and Bipolar I Disorder (manic/mixed episodes).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Schizophrenia: Start 5-10 mg daily. Bipolar I: Start 10-15 mg daily.

drugs.description: Used to treat overactive bladder symptoms like frequent or urgent urination and incontinence.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Competes with acetylcholine at receptors in the bladder to reduce contractions.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include dry mouth, headache, constipation, and abdominal pain.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for overactive bladder with symptoms of urge urinary incontinence, urgency, and frequency.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: 4 mg capsule once daily. Swallow whole. May decrease to 2 mg.

drugs.description: Short-term adjunct for weight loss in obesity, used with exercise and diet.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Stimulates the central nervous system to suppress appetite.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include heart palpitations, insomnia, dry mouth, and high blood pressure.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for exogenous obesity as a short-term adjunct to weight reduction regimen.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Individualized dosage. Usual adult dose is 37.5 mg daily before breakfast.

drugs.description: Used to treat angina, heart rhythm disorders (arrhythmias), and high blood pressure.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Calcium channel blocker; inhibits calcium ion influx into cardiac and smooth muscle cells.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include constipation, dizziness, nausea, and low blood pressure.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Angina, Arrhythmias, and Essential Hypertension.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Individualized by titration. Angina/HTN often start at 80 mg 3x daily.

drugs.description: Used to treat allergies, motion sickness, nausea/vomiting, and for sedation.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Antihistamine with sedative and antiemetic effects.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include drowsiness, dizziness, and dry mouth. Severe respiratory depression risks.
drugs.boxedWarning: Do not use in children under 2 years due to potential for fatal respiratory depression.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for allergies, motion sickness, nausea/vomiting, and sedation.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Contraindicated in <2 years. Allergy: 25 mg at bedtime. Nausea: 25 mg. Rectal suppository.

drugs.description: Used to treat very high triglycerides to reduce the risk of pancreatitis.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Lowers triglycerides and VLDL, and increases HDL.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include indigestion, stomach pain, and diarrhea.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for treatment of adult patients with very high serum triglyceride levels (Types IV and V).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: 1,200 mg daily in two divided doses, 30 minutes before morning and evening meals.

drugs.description: An antibiotic used to treat urinary tract infections (UTIs).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Inactivates bacterial proteins, killing the bacteria.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, vomiting, and loss of appetite. Can cause lung and liver problems.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for treatment of urinary tract infections due to susceptible bacterial strains.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Adults: 50-100 mg four times a day with food.

drugs.description: Antiviral used to treat and prevent influenza (flu) A and B.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Inhibits the influenza virus neuraminidase enzyme, preventing viral release.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, vomiting, and headache.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for treatment and prophylaxis of acute, uncomplicated influenza A and B.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Treatment: 75 mg twice daily for 5 days. Prophylaxis: 75 mg once daily for 10 days.

drugs.description: Antiviral used to treat cold sores, genital herpes, and shingles (herpes zoster).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Inhibits viral DNA replication.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, nausea, and abdominal pain.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Cold Sores, Genital Herpes (treatment/suppression), and Herpes Zoster.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Dose varies by condition. Cold sores: 2 grams every 12 hours for 1 day.

drugs.description: Topical antibiotic cream for treating skin infections like impetigo.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Inhibits bacterial protein synthesis.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, rash, and nausea. Local irritation.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for secondarily infected traumatic skin lesions due to S. aureus and S. pyogenes.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Apply small amount to affected area 3 times daily for 10 days.

drugs.description: Used to treat symptoms of an enlarged prostate (BPH) and high blood pressure.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Blocks alpha-1 adrenergic receptors to relax muscles in the prostate and blood vessels.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include fatigue, malaise, low blood pressure, and dizziness.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) and Hypertension.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Start 1 mg once daily. Titrate up to 8 mg (BPH) or 16 mg (Hypertension) as needed.

drugs.description: An antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections and severe acne.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Bacteriostatic antibiotic that inhibits protein synthesis.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include fever, discoloration of secretions, and GI upset.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for various infections (Rickettsial, respiratory, STDs) and acne.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Usual dose 200 mg initially followed by 100 mg every 12 hours.

drugs.description: Used to treat erectile dysfunction (ED).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Increases blood flow to the penis by inhibiting the enzyme PDE5.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, flushing, upset stomach, and vision changes.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of erectile dysfunction.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take 50 mg about 1 hour before sexual activity. Dose can be adjusted (25-100 mg).

drugs.description: Topical lotion used to treat acne vulgaris.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Antibiotic; mechanism in treating acne is unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include burning, itching, and dryness of the skin.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of acne vulgaris.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Apply thin film to affected area twice daily. Shake well before use.

drugs.description: Used to treat Parkinson's disease and Restless Legs Syndrome (RLS).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Stimulates dopamine receptors in the brain.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, sleepiness, dizziness, and vomiting.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for Parkinsons disease and moderate-to-severe primary Restless Legs Syndrome (RLS).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: PD: Start 0.25 mg 3x daily. RLS: Start 0.25 mg once daily before bed. Titrate up.

drugs.description: A corticosteroid used to induce remission in active, mild to moderate ulcerative colitis.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Anti-inflammatory corticosteroid.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, nausea, fatigue, and acne.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the induction of remission in active, mild to moderate ulcerative colitis.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: 9 mg tablet once daily in the morning for up to 8 weeks. Swallow whole.

drugs.description: Antiseptic handwash for healthcare personnel to reduce bacteria.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Healthcare personnel handwash to help reduce bacteria.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Wet hands, apply 5 mL, wash vigorously for 30 seconds, rinse and dry.

drugs.description: Topical powder used to treat fungal skin infections caused by Candida.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Adverse events are rare (less than 0.1%), may include burning or itching.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for cutaneous or mucocutaneous mycotic infections caused by Candida albicans.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Apply to lesions 2-3 times daily until healed. Dust on feet/shoes for foot infections.

drugs.description: Topical gel for temporary relief of arthritis pain in hands, wrists, elbows, feet, ankles, and knees.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.formula: Active ingredient Diclofenac sodium (NSAID*) 1% (equivalent to 0.93% diclofenac) *nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Temporary relief of arthritis pain in specific upper and lower body areas.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Use 4 times/day. Use dosing card: 2g for upper body areas, 4g for lower body areas.

drugs.description: Used for the short-term treatment of insomnia (trouble sleeping).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include drowsiness, headache, fatigue, and nervousness.
drugs.boxedWarning: Risks of profound sedation, coma, and death if used with opioids. Abuse and addiction potential.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for short-term treatment of insomnia (generally 7-10 days).
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Take 15 mg before retiring (7.5 mg or 30 mg may be used).

drugs.description: Relieves itching from skin irritations like eczema, insect bites, and poison ivy.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Mechanism unknown.
drugs.sideEffects: See warnings.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Temporarily relieves itching associated with minor skin irritations and rashes.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Apply to affected area not more than 3 to 4 times daily.

drugs.description: Common pain reliever and fever reducer.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Believed to inhibit prostaglandin synthesis in the central nervous system.
drugs.sideEffects: Generally well-tolerated. Rare allergic reactions or liver damage in overdose.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Relief of mild to moderate pain and reduction of fever.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Adults: 500-1000 mg every 4-6 hours. Max 4000 mg/24 hours.

drugs.description: Antiviral used to treat and prevent the flu (influenza).
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Selectively inhibits influenza virus neuraminidase to stop viral replication.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include nausea, vomiting, headache, and abdominal pain.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Treatment and prophylaxis of influenza A and B in adults and children.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Treatment: 75 mg orally twice daily for 5 days. Prophylaxis: 75 mg orally once daily for 10+ days.

drugs.description: Antibiotic primarily used to treat tuberculosis (TB) and leprosy.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Inhibits bacterial RNA synthesis by blocking RNA polymerase.
drugs.sideEffects: Reddish-orange discoloration of bodily fluids, nausea, liver damage, and flu-like syndrome.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Primary treatment for tuberculosis (TB) and leprosy. Also for meningitis prophylaxis.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: TB Adults: 10 mg/kg (max 600 mg) once daily orally.

drugs.description: Used to treat erectile dysfunction in men.
drugs.mechanismOfAction: Relaxes muscles and increases blood flow to the penis during sexual stimulation.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects include headache, flushing, indigestion, and visual disturbances.
drugs.indicationsAndUsage: Indicated for the treatment of erectile dysfunction (ED) in adult men.
drugs.dosageAndAdministration: Recommended 50 mg taken orally approx. 1 hour before sexual activity. Max once daily.
